tit.e: Kajin no Kigu (Chance Meeting Beautiful Women)
tit.cmt: 佳人之奇遇 ー定訳不明
tit.e: Kajin no Kigu (Encounters with Beautiful Women)
tit.cmt: コメントで訳が不明とのことでしたので、想定されそうな訳に修正しました。
tit.e: Kajin no Kigu (Encounters with Beautiful Women)

sen.j: 佳人之奇遇（かじんのきぐう）は、東海散士（柴四朗）の政治小説。
sen.e: Kajin no Kigu is a political fiction written by Sanshi TOKAI (Shiro SHIBA).
Kajin no Kigu is a political fiction written by Sanshi TOKAI (Shiro SHIBA).
Kajin no Kigu is a political fiction written by Sanshi TOKAI (Shiro SHIBA).

sen.j: 初編は1885年（明治18年）に刊行され、その後1888年までに四編まで刊行された。
sen.e: With the first book being published in 1885, the three subsequent books were printed by 1888.
With the first book being published in 1885, the three subsequent books were printed by 1888.
With the first book being published in 1885, the three subsequent books were printed by 1888.

sen.j: その後、帝国議会後の1891年に五編が、日清戦争後の1897年に六編から八編まで刊行され、完結をみた。
sen.e: The fifth book was subsequently published in 1891 after the inauguration of the Imperial Diet and, after the Sino-Japanese War, the sixth through eighth book which concluded Kajin no Kigu were published.

The fifth book was published in 1891 after the inauguration of the Imperial Diet, and the sixth through eighth book which concluded Kajin no Kigu were subsequently published after the Sino-Japanese War in 1897.
sen.cmt: 最初の一文の文体に合わせて順序を修正しました。日清戦争後の「1897年に」が訳文で欠けていましたので追加しました。
sen.e: The fifth book was published in 1891 after the inauguration of the Imperial Diet, and the sixth through eighth book which concluded Kajin no Kigu were subsequently published after the Sino-Japanese War in 1897.
Kajin no Kigu consists of 16 volumes.
Kajin no Kigu consists of 16 volumes.
Kajin no Kigu consists of 16 volumes.

sen.j: 会津藩の遺臣である東海散士がアメリカ合衆国にわたり、アイルランドの美女紅蓮、スペインの貴女幽蘭にめぐりあうのが発端。
sen.e: The story begins when the surviving retainer of the Aizu Clan Sanshi TOKAI arrived in the U. S. and met the Irish beauty Guren and the Spanish noble lady Yuran.
The story begins when a survived retainer of Aizu Clan, Sanshi TOKAI visited the USA, and encountered with an Irish beauty Guren and a Spanish noble lady Yuran.
sen.cmt: 「arrived in the U. S.」となっていますが文法的に問題がありますし、「アメリカに渡り」の原文と多少意味が異なりますので修正しました。定冠詞の利用に問題がありましたので不定冠詞へいくつか訂正しています。
sen.e: The story begins when a survived retainer of Aizu Clan, Sanshi TOKAI visited the USA, and encountered with an Irish beauty Guren and a Spanish noble lady Yuran.

sen.j: いずれも亡国の憂いを抱き、権利の回復運動に進もうとするかれらの交情が描かれる。
sen.e: The story develops around the friendship among the three of them who were grieving over their circumstances of being on exile and attempting to restore their rights.
The story develops around the friendship among those three, who were grieving over their circumstances of being on exile, and trying to restore their rights.
sen.cmt: 多少の言い回し修正を行ないました。「attempting」と〜ing形になることは余り無いように思います。tryingとしました。
sen.e: The story develops around the friendship among those three, who were grieving over their circumstances of being on exile, and trying to restore their rights.

sen.j: 世界を舞台に憂国の志士と美女を配し、政治的背景を展開する。
sen.e: With a patriot and two beautiful women being the main characters, the storyline develops along the political context using the world as a background.
With patriots and beautiful women being the main characters, the storyline develops along with the worldwide political contexts.
sen.cmt: 憂国の志士の訳を単数形から複数形にしました。訳者は美女を上述の二人としていますが、この文意からすると世界各国の美女を指しているようです。そのように修正しました。その他、文意に合わせ簡略化し、わかり易い文章としました。
sen.e: With patriots and beautiful women being the main characters, the storyline develops along with the worldwide political contexts.

sen.j: 東アジア経営にかんする意見、世界の地誌、世界史への注釈などがくわわる。
sen.e: Opinions on managing the eastern Asia, comments on the world topography and world history and the like were also included.
The story line is colored by the explanately notes regarding the management and administration of Eastern Asian countries, world topography, world history and other various information.
sen.cmt: 日本語の語順に合わせず、主語を強調する形に変更しています。東アジアは「Eastern Asian」と大文字になります。注釈は一般的な「explanately notes」と変更しました。
sen.e: The story line is colored by the explanately notes regarding the management and administration of Eastern Asian countries, world topography, world history and other various information.

sen.j: 後半になると、作者自身が谷干城に随行してヨーロッパを視察したときの体験が混ざり、また金玉均との交友から朝鮮半島をめぐる議論や日清戦争後の三国干渉をめぐる議論が作品の主軸を占めるようになり、佳人の面影は作品からは遠ざかっていく。
sen.e: In the latter half of Kajin no Kigu, the author's own experience during his visit to Europe in attendance on Tateki TANI was blended into the storyline and, in addition, due Tokai's friendship with Kim Ok-gyun, discussions on Korean Peninsula and arguments concerning the Triple Intervention after the Sino-Japanese War became the focal point of the book whereby coming to have a very little to do with those beautiful women.

In the latter half of Kajin no Kigu, the storyline began to reflect author's own experience of visitting Europe as a delegation member of Tateki TANI; gradually the focal point of the story shifted to the discussions on Korean Peninsula reflecting the friendship of the author with Kim Ok-gyun, or the arguments concerning the Triple Intervention after the Sino-Japanese War; in the end, the subjects of the story moved away from the reminiscencea of those beautiful female characters.
sen.cmt: 「混ざり」「随行」などの直訳が目立ちます。文意を汲みとって意訳するように修正しました。原文はいくつか意味の違う文章が一文章に混在しますので、その点を留意してはっきりと区切り、分かりにくくならないよう修正しました。
sen.e: In the latter half of Kajin no Kigu, the storyline began to reflect author's own experience of visitting Europe as a delegation member of Tateki TANI; gradually the focal point of the story shifted to the discussions on Korean Peninsula reflecting the friendship of the author with Kim Ok-gyun, or the arguments concerning the Triple Intervention after the Sino-Japanese War; in the end, the subjects of the story moved away from the reminiscencea of those beautiful female characters.
